page.title: 04ECOLGY/WILDLIFE
page.content: The banks of the Cairn, the banks of the Glasgow-Carlisle railway line and the old Moniaive line provide varied habitats for wildlife. Rabbits are plentiful. Roe deer are in woodland. Hare, fox, frog, red squirrel and otter are present. There are fewer ground nesting birds due to mink. Numbers of pheasant, partridge, waterfowl, pigeons, oyster catchers, barn owls, plovers, seagulls and crows are average. Farmers note an increase in ring doves and ducks, green wood- pecker are also increasing. Swans and kingfishers nest on the banks ofthe Cairn. One pair of corncrakes is nest- ing in the area. Greylag geese winter graze on Cormaddie. The farmers are aware of an increase of effluent in the burns and ditches where the grass grows greener.
